meanings.definition: A person who is habitually gloomy or sullen.
meanings.sent1: The group of sourpusses always seemed sad.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to cheer up the sourpusses in class.
meanings.sent3: The party was full of sourpusses until the clown arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her face lit up, dispelling the sourpusses around her.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds matched the mood of the sourpusses.

meanings.definition: A facial expression showing displeasure or discontent.
meanings.sent1: Their sourpusses made it clear they were unhappy.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her sourpusses during the boring meeting.
meanings.sent3: The baby made a cute sourpuss when tasting the lemon.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the essence of a sourpuss perfectly.
meanings.sent5: His sourpuss was so intense, it could sour milk.
